page.title: 08FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (3).
page.content: {Cows for milking and cattle for meat. Nine farms of the seventeen keep cows and sell milk. Another four farms keep some cows for feeding calves.In the area 620 cows are kept for their milk.Altogether,every day,these cows produce 6055 litres of milk.One farmer makes cheese.Eleven farmers make cream and four farmers make butter. Fifteen farmers kept bullocks.One farmer kept 170 and two kept below 10. Most kept between 20 and 100.The fifteen farmers kept 1024 bullocks between them.The favourite breed was Friesian, though there were a few Hereford and Welsh Black. {Pigs.}Five of the seventeen farmers kept pigs but only two of these went in for pig farming in a big way,one keeping 214 and the other 75.The most popular breed was Welsh, though one farmer kept 75 Large White Lanrace.
